Description: Floor sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery cup; glazed black on interior and underside with reserved central disc; on interior, stamped ovules (part of one preserved) surrounded by probably eight linked palmettes (two preserved); inscription cut on underside.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hellenion (Naukratis), Site 54 (Hogarth), SE part of Hellenion (found 'in the surface rubbish beyond [= to the East of] 54')
Curator's comments: See also, U. Höckmann and A. Möller 2004: The Hellenion at Naukratis: Questions and Observations. In A. Villing and U. Schlotzhauer (eds.), Naukratis: Greek Diversity in Egypt, p. 13, fig. 6. .
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (no. 114)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 705, no. 637)
Höckmann & Möller 2006 / The Hellenion at Naukratis: Questions and Observations (p.13 fig.6, no.27)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1679)
Masson 1983 / Les inscriptions chypriotes syllabiques. Recueil critique et commenté (p. 354, no. 370)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School at Athens
